text.2_Daf, 2_Line: "[It is necessary that this declaration should be made] even [when it was brought] from [the villages] Rakam and Chagar."
text.2_Daf, 14_Line: but if any demur is made, its validity must be proved by the signatures [of the attesting witnesses].
text.2_Daf, 4_Line: "Even from the village of the Luddites to Lud [Lydda]."
text.16_Daf, 20_Line: Should a messenger bring a Get from a place beyond sea, and is not able to testify that it was written and signed in his presence, its validity must be proved by the signatures of the attesting witnesses.
text.2_Daf, 6_Line: "A person is bound to declare, 'It was written and signed in my presence.' only when he brings a Get from a place beyond sea, or carries it thither.
text.2_Daf, 13_Line: Whoever brings a Get within the limits of the Holy Land, need not declare, "It was written and signed before me,"
text.16_Daf, 21_Line: Both Gittin of women and deeds of manumission for slaves, are alike in respect to the person who brings them from, or carries them to [a distant country], and this is one of the points in which the laws respecting Gittin and deeds of manumission are alike.
text.2_Daf, 11_Line: But R. Meir is of opinion
text.2_Daf, 10_Line: from Rakam and beyond [Rakam included] all places towards the east, from Ascalon and beyond [including that place] every part towards the south. From Acco and beyond [Acco included] every place towards the north.
text.2_Daf, 9_Line: R. Jehudah [considers as beyond the limits of Palestine]
text.2_Daf, 8_Line: "Also by one who only brings it from one lordship [jurisdiction] to another [jurisdiction]."...
text.2_Daf, 7_Line: And the same must be declared by a messenger who, in a country beyond sea, brings a Get from one province to another." Rabbon Simeon ben Gamaliel saith,
text.2_Daf, 12_Line: "That Acco must, in respect to Get, be considered as an integral part of the Holy Land."
text.2_Daf, 0_Line: It is necessary that a messenger who, from a foreign country, brings a Get [from a husband to his wife], should declare, "This document was written and signed in my presence."
